title: Laos–Pakistan relations
text:
Laos–Pakistan relations are bilateral relations between <a href="Laos">Laos</a> and <a href="Pakistan">Pakistan</a>. They have friendly relations and mutually beneficial cooperation in political, economics and trade fields.
In 2004 Pak PM <a href="Zafarullah%20Jamali">Zafarullah Jamali</a> visited Laos on an invitation of PM <a href="Bounnhang%20Vorachith">Bounnhang Vorachith</a> of Laos, both countries reaffirmed their commitment to implement the purpose and principles of the UN charter in their bilateral relations and to contribute to peaceful settlement of conflicts and disputes around the globe.
Pak Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf Visited Laos in 2012 to attend ASEM meeting.
Pakistan and Laos have an annual trade of approx 10 million US dollars.
Many Laos students are currently studying in Pakistani universities.
